{"step_by_step_thinking": "This question is about blood typing and the presence of Rh factor. Since no agglutination is seen after adding antiserum A and B and Rh +ve factor to the blood sample, it means that the Rh factor in the blood sample matches with the Rh factor in the added serum. This rules out choices C and D as they would have caused an agglutination reaction.", "answer_choice": "A"}
